Hi All - I am looking to add simple lines of text beneath my dropdown menu links. Here's a sample shot of the menu structure. I would like to add a line of text (preferably in a <p> tag)  beneath each link. Looking in the 'Advanced Menu' settings screen there doesn't seem to be much to help me. When I try adding an 'Item', it still defaults to rendering as an anchor tag.

Wondering if I need to create a custom HTML menu in order to have this flexibility, but wanted to ask you fine folks first. Thank you!
i would look at the `menu` function <https://designers.HubSpot.com/en/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-functions>

Hey does anyone happen to know if you can use snippits in the CSS?
for example is there a way to do something like this:
<@ULH765N65> You have to do it in the main HTML/HubL panel within <style> tags
darn I was hoping to use it on a pseudo element so it needed to be in the css, aw well, Thanks for your advice <@U2H1Q3F8R> !
Ohhh Game Changer! I didn't think you could do that, thanks!

you can also wrap that style tag in a `require_css_block`
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-tags#require-css>

Which will move it to the head
